result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor C Layne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with  any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended  treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously done, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor C Layne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Request To Limit DOC Deductions received, signed, and filed with the court.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request to for an order directing the Department of Corrections to limit its collection of funds to 25%.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (12 pages) commencing NOVEMER 10, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant Victor C Layne in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Victor C Layne IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
Credit for 183 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Atty. Mary Scholle appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant is currently IN CUSTODY.  ADA Timothy Cotter appeared on behalf of the State.

Matter in court on a WALK-IN basis.
Atty. Scholle requests to reschedule the 10-03-2014 at 8:30 AM Sentencing Hearing date.
Defense needs more time to prepare.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-10-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Victor C Layne in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Victor C Layne in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties request a sentencing hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 10-03-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing,

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Victor C Layne not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.
Parties are close to a resolution and need more time to work out the details.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 08-04-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.
**Court CANCELLED the 08-18-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Victor C Layne not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
The ADA of record, Timothy Cotter, is currently out on medical leave.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-22-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Final Pretrial Conference.

Attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Victor C Layne not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Fitzsimmons moves to withdraw defense's motion to dismiss filed on 02-28-2014.
No objections.
Court ALLOWS defense's motion filed 02-28-2014 to be withdrawn.
Defense requests a Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial dates.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 06-16-2014 at 1:30 PM for Final Pretrial Conference AND 08-18-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Victor C Layne not in court, defendant in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Off record.  Court file not in court.

Defense request for a status date is approved.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 02  Status conference scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  FEBRUARY 27, 2014  received and filed. (14 Pages.)

to Dismiss filed by Atty. Melissa Fitzsimmons on behalf of the defendant; filed.

Defendant Victor C Layne in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Victor C Layne in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Fedel-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DeShawn D. and David W.

Defendant Victor C Layne in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Victor C Layne in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
